H0.text: Red giants are the stage during which a star spends most of its life as it evolves through several stages during its lifetime.

H1.text: A red dwarf is the stage in a star’s lifetime during which it spends most of its life.

H2.text: White dwarf is the stage in which a star spends most of its life during its lifetime as it evolves through several stages.

H3.text: The main sequence is the stage during a star’s lifetime in which it spends most of its life.

A4.text: The main sequence represents the primary hydrogen-burning stage of a star's lifetime.

A5.text: About 90% of the observed stars above 0.5 M☉ will be on the main sequence.
